actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned pursuant to a previous special order. The next meeting is scheduled for 9:30 a.m. on January 9, 2025.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mrs. Bice moved that the House do now adjourn.
Mrs. Bice asked unanimous consent That, when the House adjourns on Tuesday, January 7, 2025, it adjourn to meet at 9:30 a.m. on Thursday, January 9, 2025. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 264

actions-list.actionItem: Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 29 — "To require the Secretary of Homeland Security to take into custody aliens who have been charged in the United States with theft, and for other purposes."
The Chair announced the unfinished business was the question on passage of H.R. 29, which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of January 7.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.

At the conclusion of debate on H.R. 29, the Chair put the question on passage of the bill and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Raskin demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.R. 29.

Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 5. H.R. 29 — "To require the Secretary of Homeland Security to take into custody aliens who have been charged in the United States with theft, and for other purposes."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Correa to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
